name: market for flax straw, dew-retted | flax straw, dew-retted | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30627/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for ' flax straw, dew-retted ', in the geography of Europe.;This dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of flax straw, dew-retted, from the production farm to the place it is later used. No losses are considered in this dataset.;The product 'flax straw, dew-retted' is a fiber crop and it is an annual crop.

The activity starts at the gate of flax production cultivation farm, within the geography of Europe.

This activity ends with the supply of 'flax, straw, dew-retted', to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is the same as the in transforming activity for the same reference product.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent the situation in Europe.

exchanges.description: The data refer to flax straw, dew-retted in Western europe (France, Belgium and the Netherlands), the 1st step to produce European Flax™ fibre. European Flax™ is a certification of origin and traceability owned by the Alliance for European Flax-Linen and Hemp (formerly known as CELC) which covers 100% of the fibres obtained from western European retted flax plants, and guarantees third party verified traceability downstream. The unit is 1kg of retted flax plant  in 2014-2028 through Flax cultivation, retting and harvesting. Cultivation is modelled after the average common technical itinerary in the 3 countries including crop rotation; absence of irrigation (flax fields are not irrigated in western Europe, barring exceptional circumstances); reasoned use of fertiliser and pesticide; and 100% dew retting. It is 100% specific of Western Europe and cannot be used to represent any other geography. The detailed technical itinerary is available from the Alliance.

exchanges.description: The crops are transported by lorry in a total distance of 40 km from field to scutching.
